subject: Re: [junit] Best approach for Unit testing asynch responses?
msgSnippet: So said  nsparis  on  2002-11-12 ... Test sending a message and receiving a message separately. Test: if I send a message, does the Messenger have the message?
messageBody:
So said nsparis on 2002-11-12

>I am wondering what would be the best approach to test an asynch
>response. For instance I have a simple object Messenger that allows
>messages to be added. Users may subscribe (MessengerLister) to the
>messenger to be updated of responses.

Test sending a message and receiving a message separately.

Test: if I send a message, does the Messenger have the message?
Test: if the Messenger has messages, does it try to send the messages?
Test: if I listen to the Messenger and it sends messages, do I hear the
messages?

That's a quick sketch of the "positive" tests I'd write. All can be
written synchronously.
